content.text: 4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves
content.eamr: ( ing-0 "4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves" )

content.text: 1 cup milk
content.eamr: ( ing-1 "1 cup milk" )

content.text: 1 cup dry bread crumbs
content.eamr: ( ing-2 "1 cup dry bread crumbs" )

content.text: 1 cup grated Parmesan cheese
content.eamr: ( ing-3 "1 cup grated Parmesan cheese" )

content.text: 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley
content.eamr: ( ing-4 "2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley" )

content.text: 1 cup olive oil
content.eamr: ( ing-5 "1 cup olive oil" )

content.text: 1 orange, sliced into rounds
content.eamr: ( ing-6 "1 orange, sliced into rounds" )

content.text: 1 cup dry white wine
content.eamr: ( ing-7 "1 cup dry white wine" )

content.text: 1/2 cup orange juice
content.eamr: ( ing-8 "1/2 cup orange juice" )

content.text: 1 (10.5 ounce) can chicken broth
content.eamr: ( ing-9 "1 (10.5 ounce) can chicken broth" )

content.text: 1/4 cup brandy-based orange liqueur (Grand Marnier)
content.eamr: ( ing-10 "1/4 cup brandy-based orange liqueur (Grand Marnier)" )

content.text: 0) Slice chicken breasts in thirds horizontally to make 12 thin chicken fillets.
1) Lightly pound each piece.
2) Place in a dish, and pour milk over them.
3) Soak for 10 minutes.
4) In a shallow bowl, stir together the bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese and parsley.
content.eamr:
( inst-4 / R
	:inform ( ac-4-0 "stir"@22:26 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-2 "the bread crumbs"@36:52 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-3 "Parmesan cheese"@54:69 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-4 "parsley"@74:81 / FOOD )
		:loc ( tool-4-0 "a shallow bowl"@6:20 / TOOL )
	)
)

content.text: 5) Set aside.
6) Heat olive oil in a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat.
content.eamr:
( inst-6 / R
	:inform ( ac-6-0 "Heat"@3:7 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-5 "olive oil"@8:17 / FOOD )
		:loc ( tool-6-0 "a large heavy skillet"@21:42 / TOOL )
		:heat ( temp-6-0 "medium-high heat"@48:64 / TEMPERATURE )
	)
)

content.text: 7) Dredge chicken pieces in the bread crumb mixture, and place in the hot oil.
8) Quickly brown on both sides, then remove to a buttered 9x13 inch baking dish, or similar size.
9) Season with salt and pepper to taste.
content.eamr:
( inst-9 / R
	:inform ( ac-9-0 "Season"@4:10 / AC
		:ppt ( "salt and pepper"@16:31 / FOOD )
		:prp ( purp-9-0 "to taste"@32:40 / PURPOSE_CLAUSE )
		:gol ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 10) Place orange slices over the top of the chicken.
11) Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
content.eamr:
( inst-11 / R
	:inform ( ac-11-0 "Preheat"@4:11 / AC
		:ppt ( tool-11-0 "the oven"@12:20 / TOOL )
		:heat ( temp-11-0 "350 degrees F"@24:37 / TEMPERATURE )
		:heat ( temp-11-1 "175 degrees C"@39:52 / TEMPERATURE )
	)
)

content.text: 12) Drain the oil from the skillet, reserving 1/4 cup.
13) Heat the reserved oil with the wine over medium heat until reduced by 1/2.
content.eamr:
( inst-13 / R
	:inform ( ac-13-0 "Heat"@4:8 / AC
		:ppt ( "the reserved oil"@9:25 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-7 "the wine"@31:39 / FOOD )
		:heat ( temp-13-0 "medium heat"@45:56 / TEMPERATURE )
		:until ( cond-13-0 "until reduced by 1/2"@57:77 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
	)
)

content.text: 14) Add broth and orange juice, and reduce by 1/2 again.
content.eamr:
( inst-14 / R
	:inform ( ac-14-0 "Add"@4:7 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-9 "broth"@8:13 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-10 "orange juice"@18:30 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
	:inform ( ac-14-1 "reduce"@36:42 / AC
		:gol ( cond-14-0 "by 1/2 again"@43:55 / OTHER )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 15) Pour the sauce over the chicken, then drizzle with Grand Marinier.
16) Bake for 20 to 25 minutes in the preheated oven, until bubbly.
content.eamr:
( inst-16 / R
	:inform ( ac-16-0 "Bake"@4:8 / AC
		:duration ( dur-16-0 "20 to 25 minutes"@13:29 / DUR )
		:loc ( tool-16-0 "the preheated oven"@33:51 / TOOL )
		:until ( cond-16-0 "until bubbly"@53:65 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
	)
)
